sub_title: Chevening Alumnus | Researcher & Consultant | AI Policy & Internet Freedom
summary:
I'm an academic, researcher, and consultant specialising in information technology law and human rights. I'm a passionate advocate of experiential education and practice-informed research. My work revolves around developing legal education and exploring the interplay between law, policy, society, and technology with a focus on issues of AI governance, internet regulation, digital rights, automation of justice, digital identity, and digital government.

And this is my life motto: 
“Therefore I say: Be cautious and circumspect in all you do, and from this, good fortune will arise. Calmly and respectfully think about your actions, and honor and fame will await you.” 

McCausland, Shane (2003), First Masterpiece of Chinese Painting: The Admonitions Scroll, British Museum Press, p. 78.

'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Nairobi, Kenya', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Strathmore University', 'description': 'The project I am working on is part of the CYRILLA Collaborative, a US Gov funded global initiative that seeks to map and analyse the evolution and impacts of legal frameworks on digital environments, offering an open, multilingual database of digital rights law from around the world, and particularly the Global South.\xa0

The Collaborative is currently led by Strathmore University Centre for Intellectual Property and Information Technology Law (CIPIT) and comprises several organisations: Association for Progressive Communications (APC), Social Media Exchange (SMEX), Columbia University Global Freedom of Expression (CGFoE), and Derechos Digitales (DD).

Through the project, CIPIT and the Collaborative aims at promoting digital rights, specifically internet access and the free flow of information by enabling civil society, journalists, and policymakers to leverage the CYRILLA database to strengthen policy advocacy efforts, shape the regulatory frameworks governing the internet, and respond to existing and emerging threats to internet freedom.

As a consultant, I will be supporting the development and delivery of research outputs around digital rights and policy advocacy and will be responsible for articulating a work plan to achieve the objectives of the project and ensuring sustainability through strategic partnerships.', 'title': 'Digital Policy Consultant, CIPIT', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 2624, 'name': 'Columbia University in the City of New York', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFxn78nvVaTDA/company-logo_400_400/0/1599911757575?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=MKfqjTz3VgA0rcbbmSIdx-8a3q_uiQgxzzvAJlFm4Uo', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/columbia-university/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'New York, United States', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Columbia University', 'description': 'Through a Global Database of Case Law, Columbia Global Freedom of Expression surveys jurisprudence around the world, critically reviews exemplary cases, engages in comparative analysis, and aims to identify national, regional and global trends with a focus on digital rights, particularly free speech, internet access and privacy.

My role, at first, was to create the Arabic version of the Global database from scratch alongside writing and editing case analyses. The Arabic version of the case law database focuses on jurisprudence in the Middle East and North Africa, offering a range of case law on digital rights.

Currently, my work extends to participation in a number of research projects encompassing issues around internet access, internet regulation, and the abuse of court process.', 'title': 'Legal Researcher, Global Freedom of Expression', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 928671, 'name': 'The British University in Egypt', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4D0BAQEnNUe8hEFRuw/company-logo_400_400/0/1663660699089?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=bIw-BjyDesru64PRMIpM8YH_wkkTc2N_14poDnCF2Ss', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/the-british-university-in-egypt/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Cairo, Egypt', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'company': 'The British University in Egypt', 'description': 'At the British University in Egypt (BUE), my role extended beyond teaching and research to exploring collaborations, and establishing & developing projects.

- Project Management

One of my proudest accomplishments was leading the creation of the first-ever Moot Court Unit in Egyptian law schools. To offer students the opportunity to explore the world of law beyond the classroom, the Unit focuses on organising internal moots, facilitating participation in external ones, and hosting reputable regional and international moots.

The Legal Practice & Development Centre was another exciting project that I worked on, aimed at putting "Law in Action" at the heart of legal education. The Centre offered sessions delivered by legal experts on lawyering skills. We also provided career advice to senior students and helped them apply for internships, build a competitive profile, and orient them with scholarship opportunities.

In my quest to explore collaboration opportunities, I secured a cooperation agreement with Raoul Wallenberg Institute (RWI) to sponsor the Faculty’s Human Rights Conference and for the BUE to join the Academic Network of RWI, which is a consortium of academic institutions cooperating to advance access to justice and the implementation of human rights.

I was also honoured to participate in revamping the curriculum to keep up with the latest developments in the legal field and to make it centred around active learning. We ensured that clinical education and mooting were integrated into the new programme. That wasn't all. I drafted a module on IT law, which is a first for any Egyptian law school so students can explore such a niche area of law.

Lastly, I played an active role in the planning process of the Cybercrime Investigation Masters, the first of its kind in Egypt. Our mission was to introduce an innovative, comparative-based programme with an interdisciplinary approach to offer a hands-on experience and expose students to the international scene.', 'title': 'Assistant Lecturer of Law', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Cairo Governorate, Egypt', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'The British University in Egypt', 'description': "- Research

I was actively involved in research, which included penning a thought-provoking case commentary on the US Supreme Court ruling in Van Buren, co-authoring a paper that examined the socio-legal impact of algorithmic content filtering, and contributing to a book chapter that scrutinised the Egyptian criminal justice system.

I also served as the coordinator and rapporteur for the Human Rights Conference hosted by the BUE Faculty of Law in collaboration with Raoul Wallenberg Institute and Pretoria University. 

I further had the pleasure of attending the African Human Rights Academic Network Conference, held by the Raoul Wallenberg Institute. As a representative of the BUE Law Faculty, I proudly chaired a panel discussion on the implementation of regional court decisions in Africa - a topic of utmost importance in today's world. 

- Teaching

As an educator at BUE, my teaching spanned a wide range of courses, including legal methodology, research dissertation, human rights law, EU law, public international law and international organisations for undergraduates, as well as cyberlaw and cybercrime for postgraduates.

I took great pride in designing engaging teaching materials, developing thought-provoking lesson plans, and delivering interactive tutorials and seminars. My classes focused on experiential learning – a cutting-edge approach that gets students thinking critically and participating directly in the educational process. With hands-on methods like open discussions, debates, case dissection, and legal analysis, students were able to engage in an active and effective learning process. And to keep things interesting, I used visual aids and interactive ed-tech tools like Kahoot, Nearpod & Socrative.

I was also a key player in the committee responsible for organising the summer schools on social media regulation and digital evidence. All this presented unique opportunities to learn, grow, and network with some of the brightest minds from around the world.", 'title': 'Teaching Assistant, Faculty of Law', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 68799019, 'name': 'Center for AI and Digital Policy', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGJgXEp2AM-4w/company-logo_400_400/0/1644424126303?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=fMCn1-CmtIAUkK5AOsk5cUS7jEtvcA8VjeDc2JPAP5Y', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/center-for-ai-and-digital-policy/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'company': 'Center for AI and Digital Policy', 'description': 'Researcher in the Spring AI Policy Clinic, conducted by the Center for AI and Digital Policy, which gathers AI policy advocates, practitioners, and researchers, with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and interests to investigate the AI governance scene.

The AI Policy Clinic covers topics revolving around AI History, Al ethics, Al national strategies, AI Regulation and Policy Frameworks, and Research Methods. It aims to provide future leaders in the AI policy field with the necessary skillset for policy analysis, research, evaluation, team management, and policy formation.

In addition to the interactive sessions and meetings, I got the opportunity to contribute to the 2022 Al and Democratic Values Index report published annually by the Center for AI and Digital Policy. The report assesses the AI policy environment covering 75 countries, including Egypt, and involving over 200 experts worldwide.', 'title': 'AI Policy Researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 2730855, 'name': 'Berkman Klein Center for Internet & Society at Harvard University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQFcAR6VO3hqng/company-logo_400_400/0/1519893009247?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=OsnPJlGopi7zswNubeSBoH9saljfmC8qvdnv6V5bX_A', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/berkman-center-for-internet-&-society-at-harvard-university/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Berkman Klein Center for Internet & Society at Harvard University', 'description': 'Participant in the Fall 2022 Research Sprint on "Digital Identity in Time of Crisis: Designing for Better Futures" which focuses on exploring the ethical, human rights, and societal impacts of digital identity in times of crisis.

The project aims at evaluating how digital identity systems can best serve communities in times of crisis, how to guard against harms arising either from well-intended plans gone awry or from the misuse of power, and how to envision a future in which people's digital identities are respected and supported. 

The Research Sprint is run by the Berkman Klein Center for Internet & Society, in collaboration with metaLAB (at) Harvard, the Edgelands Institute, and AccessNow.

Along with the informative and interactive sessions on various legal, policy, and societal issues around digital Identity, my participation culminated with me writing my first creative writing piece titled “Data Creep” as part of a collection of stories written by a group of participants named “Stories from (Un)Identified Worlds”.
